revised_title: Structure-Function Study of Dihydrofolate Reductase through Protein Engineering
tldr: The article discusses a structure-function study of dihydrofolate reductase (DHFR) using protein engineering techniques. The researchers engineered specific mutations in the DHFR enzyme to test its structure-function relations and analyzed the crystal structures of the mutant enzymes. The study reveals that aspartate-27 plays a role in substrate protonation, while its contribution to transition-state stabilization is negligible. The findings provide insights into the enzyme's catalytic mechanism and inhibitor binding.
